text: Harris William Fawell (March 25, 1929 - November 11, 2021) was an American politician. He was a Republican member of the Illinois Senate from 1963 to 1977, and was a delegate to the Republican National Convention in 1968 and 1988. In 1976 Fawell ran unsuccessfully for the Illinois Supreme Court. In 1984, he was elected to the U.S. House of Representatives, representing Illinois' 13th district where he served until his retirement in 1999.Profile, Votersmart.org; accessed February 7, 2017. In 2008, Fawell endorsed his home state's junior United States Senator Barack Obama for President of the United States, against his party's nominee, Arizona senator John McCain. Fawell died on November 11, 2021 in Naperville, Illinois from problems caused by Alzheimer's disease, aged 92. ==References== ==Other websites== * * Category:1929 births Category:2021 deaths Category:United States representatives from Illinois Category:Politicians from Chicago Category:Republican Party (United States) politicians Category:State legislators of the United States Category:Deaths from Alzheimer's disease Category:Disease-related deaths in Illinois
title: Harris W. Fawell
